intro: Hedyotis michauxii f. alba, commonly known as white blushing geranium, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and the Pacific. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a glossy, dark green appearance. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides.
